CatDescriptText: Mrs. Marian Barnes, postal worker, Brushton and Mr. Logan Ramey, church custodian, East Liberty, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 3, 1962, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think that in custody cases a child should be awarded to the mother, even though she may be of questionable background?...Or do you think they should be placed in a foster home, with visiting privileges being granted to the parent?"  Mrs. Barnes' answer reads: "I say that if it can be proved that the mother is that type of a mother, of questionable background, then the child should be placed in a foster home.  But it should be really proved, without a question of a doubt, that the mother is of questionable background."  Mr. Ramey's answer reads: "They should give the mother one more try."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Marian Barnes wearing fur hat and dark coat, holding paper bag in right arm, standing in front of building; Portrait of Logan Ramey wearing fedora and herringbone coat, standing in front of C.C. Mellor's, Smithfield Street, Downtown
